721183f-a.title: Manhattan: Madison Avenue - 23rd Street
721183f-a.text:
Madison Avenue, east side, from 23rd to 24th Streets. In the
oentre is the Metropolitan Life Insurance Building, whose
OxDanslon will devour the brownstone church on the left.
This is the Madison Suuare Fresbyterian Church (1854-1906)
from whose pulpit Dr. Charles Parkhurst waged unceasing war
5n Tammany Hall until that organization was temporarily,at
least, overthrown, and its leader, Richard Croker, driven
into exile.
1894.
J. S. Johnston, from Brown Brothers.

730236f-a.title: General view - [Manhattan - 23rd Street - Madison Avenue (South).]
730236f-a.text:
A general view, south from the Metropolitan Life Iusurance Building.
(Hadison Ave., and 223rd St)., showing in the centre, Union Square Park
and in the background, at the left, is the East River, with the Manhattan
(first) and Brooklyn (second) Bridges.
About 1909.
Wurts Brothers.

721219f-a.title: Manhattan: Madison Avenue - 23rd Street (East)
721219f-a.text:
Madison Avenue, east side, from 2uth to 23rd Streets along Madison
Square seen from the west. On N.E. cornen of 26th Street stands
the New York Life Building, on the site of the second Madison
Square Garden. On S.E. corner of 26th Street the Manhattan Club
(old Jerome residence) has been remodelled, balconies removed.
At the right is a good view of the Metropolitan tower at 24th
Street. This view remains substantially the same in 1935.
1926.
Photograph by Browning Studios.

721205f-b.title: Manhattan: Madison Avenue - 23rd Street (East)
721205f-b.text:
Madison Avenue, from East 23rd (right) to 26th (left) Street,
(buildings thereupon) as photographed aoross Madison Square Park
from 5th Avenue. Prominently shown is the progressive blockwide
project conducted by the Metropolitan Life Insurance Company.
This annex will on completion include the entire site from 24th
to 25th Streets, and east to 4th Avenue. The remaining structure
(N. E. corner of 24th Street), is the office building that replaced
the distinguished Madison Square Presbyterian Church.6ompleted and
occupied is the easterly half that fronts on 4th Avenue.
July 18, 1939
Views 1,2,3
P. L. Sperr

721181f-c.title: Manhattan: Madison Avenue - 23rd Street (East)
721181f-c.text:
Madison Avenue, north from East 23rd Street, showing Madison
Square Park and its surrounding structures at two different stages.
The original Madison Souare Garden at 26th Street is being replaced
by the New York Life lInsurance Company Building. Note the distinc-
tive Madison Avenue Presbyterian Church (N. E. corner of 24th Street)
and the Appellate Division of the Supreme Court (N. E. corner of
25th Street).
Views 1,2: 1908
Views 3,4: September 1928
George L. Balgue

721191f-b.title: Manhattan: Madison Avenue - 23rd Street (East)
721191f-b.text:
Madison Avenue, east side, from East 23rd (right) to 24th
Street, showing the Metropolitan Life Insurance Company building
and tower and the Madison Square Presbyterian Church. The latter,
erected in 1906, was formerly on the corner site where the tower
is rising. Expansion of the Insurance Corpany will eventually cause
this to be demolished for an office structure and which in turn
will be removed for a latter annex that will include the entire
24th to 25th Street block.
View 1: 1908
View 2: October 1914
George L. Balgue

721218f-a.title: Manhattan: Madison Avenue - 23rd Street (East)
721218f-a.text:
Madison Avenue, south from East 26th to 23rd Streets.
At the right is Madison Square, the park that identified
this thoroughfare. The Manhattan Club is the ornate struc-
ture to the left and adjoins the Madison Squre Anartments
(street canopy). On the right margfn appears a portion
of the Fuller (Flatron) Building. The low Hotel Bartholdi
is on the left of the latter.
May 18, 19244
Standard Photographic Service
Gift of Eorough President of Manhattan

721223f-b.title: Manhattan: Madison Avenue - 23rd Street (East)
721223f-b.text:
Madison Ave., at the N.E. corner of East 26th Street (the New York
Life Insurance Co. Building) as seen aoross Madison Square Park from
the west side of Fifth Ave. at 25th Street.
July 14, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same structure viewed across the south wes terly
corner of the Park (Fifth Avenue and 23rd Street) from a vantage
point at the base of the Flatiron Building.
Note the silhouetted statue of the Hon. Samuel J. Tilden
in the foreground.
August 5, 1938
George D. Chinn

Metropolitan Life 1nsurance Building, situated on Madison
Ayexew, at the northeast corner of 23rd Street and Kadison
